[b][color=white]It's Goodwill Monday![/color][/b]
Goodwill Monday is considered to be a 'public holiday' for Hack Forums, knowing that most of the forum members will be accessing this site during their summer holidays. With great pomp and joy, [color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color] encouraged everyone to give positive reputation points to other users as a sign of goodwill. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5289935]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/NotableThreads.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131]Ariana[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5289935][b]Goodwill Monday June 6th[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]On June 6 Hack Forums will be celebrating Good Will Monday. Back in the year 2010, Omniscient declared GWM as an official HF holiday. Learn more about it in this thread.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5291481][b]Lucky Clover Awards[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Omniscient revealed the way to obtain the three lucky clover awards that were added a while back. Are you lucky enough to win one?

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5287536][b]How To Get Started With Linux | A Beginner's Guide[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2440338][color=#FFFFFF][b]Sahaj[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The user Sahaj has created an epic beginners guide to Linux. With instructions on how to install the software, troubleshoot, and even some extra resources to get you started, if you're new to Linux this is the thread for you.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292054][b][TUT] HOW TO SLEEP BETTER ? EVEN FRONT OF THE SCREEN[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3126298][color=#99FF00][b]FireNice[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Having troubles falling asleep? Do you spend countless hours on the computer when you should actually be sleeping? Come check out this helpful sleeping guide by the user FireNice!

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5291540][b]Orgy Has Unlimited Reputation Power[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]What would you do if Omniscient gave the user Orgy the rep powers that administrators have?

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5291499][b]Want to get the new HackForums Awards? // Cryptic's Lounge // Chillin[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=716331][color=#FFFFFF][b]Cryptic™[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Cryptic™ created a nice little userscript to count how many characters you have in your post to assist in winning the lucky clover awards. Within the thread Cryptic™ made a little lounge where users can chat and hopefully win it.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5293001][b]Have you met anyone famous?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1241114][color=#00AAFF][b]Goku[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Are there any cool celebs that you have met over the years? Are you related to one?! If so, who?

[b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292885][b]$10 BTC - Name my YouTube Channel[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=712376][color=#FFFFFF][b]Joey[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Joey is in need of some help. He is offering $10 BTC to anyone that can help name is channel. If you have a creative mind, come help out!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5230046][b][ETERNAL]$10 PAYPAL - ALL MEMBERS[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2231565][color=#00AAFF][b]xJay[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]In need of some money? Come check out this $10 giveaway by, xJay.

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5294618][b]Exuberance's Feedback [1 month, 1000 posts, 256 posts in a day][/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3107989][color=#FFFFFF][b]Exuberance[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Exuberance shares with the community a short little feedback thread.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5294576][b]Michaels 5 year feedback thread[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827750][color=#FFFFFF][b]Μichael[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Reminiscing in some of Hack Forums finest moments, Michael created a feedback thread sharing some feedback on his 5 year anniversary of the forum.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292406][b]big dick rick's 2000 post feedback thread[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2959395][color=#EFEFEF][b]big dick rick[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]After reading big dick rick's feedback thread, you will wonder why he does not have the flamer award yet.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292785][b]Sadistic's 1000th post | 300 rep feedback[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2860998][color=#00AAFF][b]Sadistic[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]After reaching 1,000 posts and earning 300 rep, the user Sadistic tells a small little tale on why he had joined the forum.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5291263][b]Pillows' 5 Year Anniversary Feedback[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=820949][color=#00AAFF][b]Pillows[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Congratulations to Pillows who recently hit his 5 year mark on the forum. Come check out his anniversary feedback here.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292811][b]Wuss's 1.5k Posts \\ Feedback Thread // Thank you list and Hopeful changes![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2849820][color=#00AAFF][b]Wuss[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Wuss has recently reached 1.5k posts and shares his thanks and future plans on what Wuss will do in the future.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292658][b]Leminlyme's 1K Rep FEEDBACK THREAD[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=857807][color=#EFEFEF][b]LeminLyme[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Obtaining 1,000 rep is a huge milestone. The user LeminLyme did just that. With some information on his future goals and things like feedback on groups, LeminLyme shares how Hack Forums has changed his life.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292064][b]My feedback[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2960032][color=#EFEFEF][b]Zachary.[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Small little feedback from the user Zachary., where he lets the community know what he thinks of staff, the rules, and the community.

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5293235][b]My feedback on this whole clover thing[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=182754][color=#00AAFF][b]Orgy[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Orgy has left Hack Forums some very important feedback the new lucky clover awards.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292649][b]Muhammad Ali Passes Away Aged 74.[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3041232][color=#99FF00][b]Alphapanda013[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]One of the greatest boxers of all time, Muhammad Ali, passes away at the age of 74. Read more about it here.

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v2/Memo.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2504443]reve4 neeuQ[/url][/i][/b][/align]
[color=white][b]Happy Goodwill Monday![/b][/color]
Happy Goodwill Monday to all the readers! On behalf of the team, I'd like to apologize for not pushing out certain sections that may be important towards some users. Nevertheless, have a great day!

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v2/ScienceNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=910913]Intelligent Sin[/url][/i][/b][/align]
[/align]

[url=http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2016-05/uoc--ap1052616.php][b][color=white]A Whole New World[/color][/b][/url]
This week, the University Of California revisited a planet known as Kepler-62f. The planet is estimated to be 40% larger than Earth. At its size, the University of California speculates that [Kepler-62f] could consist of a rocky composition, just like us.The system that Kepler-62f calls home was originally found by NASA back in 2013. Though when found, NASA neglected to study the planet as a possible contender to host life. This time around Dr. Shields and a team of astronomers took a closer look  at the system harboring the planet. Dr. Shields states, "We found there are multiple atmospheric compositions that allow it to be warm enough to have surface liquid water," and because of that she goes on to say, "This makes it a strong candidate for a habitable planet." Unfortunately, the possibly hospitable planet is located 1,200 light-years away from Earth.

[url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160526141749.htm][b][color=white]Precisely Mapping the Brain Like Never Before[/color][/b][/url]
Previously, mapping the brain was no easy task, and when we did map the brain it was one of two ways; we could either have a detailed look at a very small section of the brain or look at the entire brain but with nothing better than grainy quality. Now, the Laboratory of Brain Development and Repair at The Rockefeller University figured out a way to take the better qualities of both methods and splice them together. This new method works by taking a picture of firing neurons in the brain the moment activity starts. Although this new method of brain capture has only been applied to mice thus far, researchers hope to transfer their progress over to human subjects in the near future. 


[url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160525084547.htm][b][color=white]Overworking Is Connected to Mental Disorders[/color][/b][/url]
Recently, a study conducted by the University of Bergen in Norway has found a link between working too much and psychiatric disorders. The study examined the lives of over 16,000 working adults and their daily work patterns. Clinical Psychologist Specialist and the lead researcher on the team Cecilie Schou Andreassen found that "Workaholics scored higher on all the psychiatric symptoms than non-workaholics." These symptoms linked correlate with popular mental disorders such as OCD, ADHD, anxiety, and depression. Schou Andreassen stresses that "physicians should not take for granted that a seemingly successful workaholic does not have ADHD-related or other clinical features. Their considerations affect both the identification and treatment of these disorders."

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/TechNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2776397]Young Thug[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[color=white][url=http://money.cnn.com/2016/06/03/technology/google-racist-chrome-extension/][b]Google pulls Anti-Semitic Chrome Extension from Chrome store[/b][/url][/color]

The Chrome extension "Coincidence Detector" was quickly removed when it was discovered to be targeting Jews.  The essential job of the extension was to highlight names compiled in a user-created list, where problems arose was when it started to put echo, or triple, parentheses around the names of Jews and civil liberty groups.  Google stated it violated their hate speech policy with regards to extensions, and soon after banned it from the Chrome store.  This has caused a great uproar amongst users of the extension, claiming that highlighting names of Jewish people is not Anti-Semitic, what do you think about the whole situation?  


[color=white][url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-06-03/wal-mart-to-start-testing-grocery-delivery-through-uber-lyft/][b]Walmart to begin testing deliveries via Uber and Lyft[/b][/url][/color]

Walmart is the world's largest retailer today, and they are constantly coming up with new ways to monopolize this business.  Their latest attempt is to combine their services with one of the world's most popular transport platforms: Uber.  Walmart states that customers will be able to visit the site, pick out the grocery items they wish to have delivered, and for a small $7 to $10 delivery fee, a driver from Uber or Lyft will fulfill the order, and bring the items straight to their door.  If this takes off for Walmart, they will have successfully cornered off the online grocery business, with their main competition being Amazon.  Testing will begin with Uber in Phoenix, and with Lyft in Denver.  If it goes well, Walmart plans to take this platform country-wide. 


[color=white][url=http://www.theverge.com/circuitbreaker/2016/6/4/11859138/oneplus-canceled-smartwatch/][b]Dreams of a OnePlus smartwatch crushed[/b][/url][/color]

OnePlus CEO Pete Lau announced that blueprints for a OnePlus smartwatch existed, but were scrapped.  The company decided that they are not big enough to branch out into that market, yet.  Lau realized that it would be too costly for his company to try to compete with those like LG and Moto who are already producing great products for Android Wear.  Lau is focused on growing the company within their already strong line of flagship Android smartphones, including the OnePlus 3.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131]Ariana[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://gamerant.com/allison-road-cancel/][b][color=white]Allison Road Has Been Cancelled[/color][/b][/url]
Allison Road was planned to be a first-person survival horror game designed for Linux, Microsoft Windows, and OS X players. The only public reason the game was cancelled was due to funding. The developers, Lilith LTD., a British game development company decided to start a Kickstarter campaign in hopes that gamers interested in seeing a brand new horror game concept would donate to the making of it. Sadly, the donation campaign did not receive as much money as needed despite the popularity and interest of the game. Other than the money being an issue, there is not really much to say about why Allison Road was cancelled. Theories created by interested fans state that maybe it is due to Allison really having no good storyline or that it was too small. With Konami cancelling the Silent Hills series horror fans are going to have to wait it out until another gaming company decides to pick up where everyone else left off.

[url=http://www.pcgamer.com/escape-from-tarkov-alpha-test-will-begin-in-august/][b][color=white]Escape from Tarkov Alpha Test Will Begin in August[/color][/b][/url]
Escape from Tarkov is an upcoming FPS game with MMO and RPG based elements to it. The game will be hosting closed alpha testing which starts on August 4. As of now, the testing is confirmed a closed alpha test and there is no public information on how to be a part it. Various different sources label the game a "modern S.T.A.L.K.E.R." type game. For those who are not familiar with the game S.T.A.L.K.E.R., it was a first-person shooter survival horror that took place in Chernobyl. Some connections between the two games can be seen, such as similar locations and the style of game. Featured in the game are cool weapon customization abilities that have never been seen before in a game. You can watch a video that has been created demonstrating the system [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tQHKJb70o2A]here[/url]. The game will be a multiplayer shooter that feature different mercenary companies as you battle in the city of Tarkov. Not much else has been released about the game. Those interested in seeing an hour long footage from developers can do so [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FIpsx6JzfC8]here[/url].

[url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-infinite-warfare-in-depth-campaign-de/1100-6440476/][b][color=white]Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare "In-Depth" Campaign Demo Coming to E3[/color][/b][/url]
The upcoming FPS game by the Call of Duty franchise titled, Infinite Warfare, had a trailer released on May 2, 2016. The first time in call of duty history, the video received more dislikes than likes. Estimating around 440,000 plus likes and two million dislikes with about 26 million views is definitely something Infinity Ward did not expect to see. Various different comments joking around about the cod points system and memes regarding buying supply drops have been posted. Some good news, however, regarding the latest game is that Infinity Warfare will be showcasing a campaign demo at this years E3 expo in Los Angeles, California. One thing to note is that Activision does not have a booth at E3 this year, but later in the month Infinity Ward (one of Activision's subsidiaries) will be showcasing an "in-depth" look into the Infinite Warfare campaign. With that being said, a possibility of a look into the multiplayer feature of the game might be shown too. The footage is set to air on June 13, but the developers at Infinity Ward have not stated where it will happen inside of E3. Thanks to Sony teaming up with Call of Duty and creating a partnership, there might be a chance that it is shown during Sony's E3 briefing. In the past, DLC was usually released first on the Xbox consoles and alter on available for Playstation. That is not the case anymore as Sony is partnered with Call of Duty. In addition to this partnership, Sony also got a deal with Destiny and it includes the same benefits as the CoD DLC's. Infinite Warfare launches on November 4 for PS4, Xbox One, and PC. All the new DLC will come to PS4 first. Players who purchase the premium version of Infinite Warfare which price averages to about $79,99 (depending on where you live) you will receive a copy of the remastered edition of Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare. [size=xx-small][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EeF3UTkCoxY]<<Infinite Warfare Trailer[/url][/size]

[/list][/spoiler]

[align=center][sp=Gaming Video of the Week]
[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XW14HO7C1Dg[/yt]
[/align]
[/sp]
[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[font=Trebuchet MS][size=1][color=transparent]       [/color]
[align=center][size=large][b][color=#e15555]Trends[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#e0d858]Comics[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=white]HF News Team[/color][/b][/size][/align]
[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Trends.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=712376]Joey[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/06/03/us/muhammad-ali/][b][color=white]Muhammad Ali Passes Away at age 74[/color][/b][/url]
The famous boxer who was known to be "The Greatest" passed earlier this week on June 3, 2016. Ali died in Arizona after a 32-year battle with Parkinson's disease at age 74. Ali's daughter, Hana Ali, tweeted out, "And now he has gone home to God. God bless you daddy. YOU ARE THE LOVE OF MY LIFE," shortly after the death of her father. While there is not any other vital information on the incident, it is definitely tragic to see such an inspirational figure pass away. The Ali family received a tremendous amount of support over various social networks such as Twitter and Facebook and asks for the general public to respect their privacy on the matter.

[url=http://www.businessinsider.com/mark-zuckerberg-twitter-pinterest-accounts-hacked-linkedin-hack-facebook-passwords-2016-6?r=UK&IR=T][b][color=white]Mark Zuckerberg Hacked on Various Social Media Networks[/color][/b][/url]
Co-founder of the Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg has now been a victim of social media hacking. On June 5, 2016, Zuckerberg's Twitter and Pinterest accounts were compromised by the infamous hacking group known as "OurMine". OurMine has also claimed to have hacked into Zuckerberg's Instagram account, but there was no solid evidence of this compared to the proof uploaded onto his other social media accounts that were hacked by the group. OurMine was able to hack into these social media accounts because Zuckerberg used the same password throughout various social media websites. If you are to gain anything out of reading this, it is highly recommended that you use different passwords on every website you sign up for. 

[url=http://www.eteknix.com/paypal-refuses-refund-twitch-troll-donated-huge-sums-money/][b][color=white]PayPal Refuses to Refund $50,000 to Troll Twitch Donator[/color][/b][/url]
In case you are not aware, Twitch is a streaming platform where anyone can stream content that pertains to gaming. People use this website as a way to communicate to people, have a good time, and some even go to the extent of streaming their gameplay full-time as a source of income. With the website constantly growing with more traffic day in and day out, this implies that the wrong sort of crowd is attracted to the website. Trolls are becoming more prevalent on the website solely for the fact that they are looking for some quick attention. iNexus_Ninja, a Twitch user, has consistently donated to multiple streamers. This is not your normal donator that donates a small amount of money out of kindness; these transactions range from $1,000 all the way up to $5,000. However, iNexus_Ninja would simply donate to see the reaction of these streamers receiving over $1,000 and around a month after donating, he would plan on submitting a chargeback through PayPal on these transactions. A chargeback refers to the process of contacting PayPal on, usually, a transaction that pertains to fraud. PayPal refused to refund these donations as there was no actual reason on the chargeback which resulted in this 18-year old teen in losing nearly $50,000 due to PayPal's decision.

[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Comics.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2776397]Young Thug[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[align=center]
[b][size=x-large]|1|[/size][/b][sp=]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/QJZArgn.png[/img][/sp]

[b][size=x-large]|2|[/size][/b][sp=]

[b][size=x-large]|4|[/size][/b][sp=]
